The LHS Thespian Troupe gathered yesterday - socially distant with masks! - to celebrate the new members of our troupe and install officers for the 20/21 school year. The troupe had a virtual induction in May, and were finally able to have an in-person ceremony last night for our new members to sign the roster. This marks the 25th anniversary of Troupe 5460, and originating troupe member, Beth Bennett ('96), joined the ceremony to install the officers and speak to the new generation of thespians.

We continue to celebrate and create theatre at LHS in this time of uncertainty, and are grateful to our administration, parents, staff, and students for all the work they are doing to keep us safe and together.

Brighten Your Future (BYF) is the Logan-Hocking community's program to provide higher education for graduates of Logan High School.

Students qualify for grants based on their need, which is determined by comparing school cost with financial resources (FAFSA) of each student.

If you would like to apply for a grant, all information must be received by July 1. The information can be put in Nan Swinehart's mailbox in the main office at Logan High School, given to Mrs. Tootle the guidance office at LHS or mailed to BYF, P.O. Box 991, Logan, OH 43138.

The application and all needed information can be found at:

Http://www.brightenyourfuturelogan.org

One of the requirements of the grant is to have a summer job. Because of the COVID-19 situation this year, if you are not able to attain a job, just include a note in the application about your circumstances.

If you have any additional questions or concerns, you can contact Nan Swinehart, Executive Director of BYF through e-mail at nswinehart@lhsd.k12.oh.us or call/ text her at 740-243-0216.

KINDERGARTEN REGISTRATION FOR LOGAN-HOCKING SCHOOLS

Registration for children who will be attending kindergarten during the 2020-2021 school year will begin the week of May 18, 2020. Parents are reminded that children must be five years of age on or before August 1, 2020, in order to be eligible to attend kindergarten in the Logan-Hocking Local School District.

Registration packets can be picked up and returned at the office of the District Registrar, 2019 East Front Street, Logan. HOURS ARE MONDAY THRU FRIDAY FROM 8-11 AM AND 1-3 PM.

If you are unable to pick up a packet during the above hours/days, please call Keri Kunkler, at 385-8517 ext. 20010. Please note that no assessments will be given this year.

Parents will need to bring with them to registration their child’s birth certificate (original with seal), immunization record, proof of custody if it is applicable, proof of residency, the child’s social security card and the parent’s photo I.D. Children CANNOT be registered without these documents.

Chief Logan Advances to State in the Agricultural Mechanic Skills CDE
Logan High School
Submitted by: Chief Logan FFA

On Thursday, March 5, 2020, the Chief Logan FFA Agricultural Mechanic Skills team travelled to Tri-County Career Center to compete in the district contest. The team qualified for the state contest by placing first. During the contest the students completed 10 stations which included areas of online part ordering, DC electricity, tool identification, part identification, engine repair, welding, soldering, fastener identification, drilling and tapping a hole, etc. The team was led by senior Collin Rimkus who placed first individually, followed by junior Erik Stufflebeam placing second, junior Colt Hull placing third, and with junior Blake Jordan as our alternate. Since the team placed within the top two, they will be advancing to the state contest at The Ohio State University, ATI Campus in Wooster, Ohio. A job well done by these students and good luck at the state contest on April 3, 2020.
